subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] I'm new.
msgSnippet: Ryan, we are all kindred spirits on the Read Alphabet group on Yahoo. As such, I m curious to know the answer to the following question from you and anyone on
messageBody:
Ryan,
we are all kindred spirits on the Read Alphabet group on Yahoo. As such, I'm curious to know the answer to the following question from you and anyone on the group.

In the Read Alphabet, how do you, personally, write the second syllable of the word February? Do you use letters 2-25-40, or 2-17-40? I pronounce it the way it is spelled. This makes me a little peculiar, since most people say what they hear other people say without regard to the spelling.
Vin    
On 9/2/2012 10:19 PM, Ryan wrote:
 

Hi everyone. I've just joined and am excited to find there are other people in the world interested in the Read Alphabet.

I first heard of Quikscript back in the late 90's and early 2000's, and at the time I thought I was just about the only person interested. Just today someone mentioned Shaw and it got me thinking about Shavian and Quikscript, so I did a quick search and found this group.

Back when I first heard about the alphabet I got pretty far in teaching myself to read and write, though I think I eventually gave up because I often had trouble with my vowels. It looks like this group has some pretty great resources available though, so hopefully I'll be able to pick it back up again.
